column4: Hey forgive me for mentioning Windows, but I have a dual boot system with windows 7 and ubuntu. I want to upgrade my Windows to Windows 8 but I want to keep my dual boot in place and keep ubuntu. Will this work? I don't have Windows 8 yet so I can't try anything but just curious if it will work
Your dual boot of ubuntu was not installed from windows was it/
cool, as suggested you will just have to reload grub to the mbr.
it wont allow me to resize extended partition. I can click resize but cant change the volume at all
Are you trying to resize a partiton yuou are booted into?
Sorry you addressed that already can you take a screen shot of gparted and imagebin it.
So you want the Windows partition bigger right?

No bigie it will take awhile though. YOU should of resized ubuntu to the roght, but you can m,ove the whole partition to the right with the resize button, then right click the extended in the menu and resize it up against the ubuntu partition the the unallocated will be next to the windows fro it to exspand into.
Just for information you could make a NTFS in that unallocated now and windows will see and and you can use it.
It is up against the ubuntu  on the left you have to move the ubuntu to the right, the whole partition at once.
what do you mean move to the right? Sorry didnt understand. And by Ubuntu do you mean the whole extended partition or the file system?
Click on the resize, you can move the whole sda5 to be up against the swap, then using the resize again on the extended move it up against the ubuntu.
No sure what worked but moving the whole ubuntu partition should take awhile.
It was practically instant, maybe because I haven't really put anything on ubuntu partition yet other than the os
cool, so you understand the process then.
